div.head: Headnote
div.p: The 3rd commandment is found in Exodus 20:7, and in Deuteronomy 5:11. The wording is the same in both the Geneva Bible and King James Version– and is identical to the wording used here.

p.hi: Thou shalt not take the name of the Lord thy god in vain; for the Lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh his name in vain

lg.l:
Here is
F: in this our heart’s corruption most expressed
And spreads itself more than in any other
Those faults that are by temporal laws depressedsupprest
Even for affliction sake we seek to smother.
But to blaspheme or take God’s name in vain,
Is held a sport, because ‘tis freed from pain.
Poor birdlime bat, who Satan hath in hold,
Thinkest thou that God will let this treason die?
‘Gainst his own honour is his care so cold,
Because he doth not thunder suddenly?
This weighty business is of so much trust,
As he will not commit it unto dust.
